title: PM Modi conferred with Trinidad and Tobago’s highest civilian honour
content: This is PM Modi's first visit to the country as Prime Minister and the first Indian bilateral visit at the Prime Ministerial level to Trinidad and Tobago since 1999.

title: Plea to continue services of temporary faculty in public universities of Andhra Pradesh
content: Members of Akhil Bharatiya Rashtriya Shaikshik Mahasangh urge the APSCHE Chairman to expedite recruitment in State Universities

title: Yakshagana artistes and their battle between the contemporary and classic
content: Balancing modernity and tradition has always been a matter of debate when it comes to creative arts. Karnataka’s Yakshagana artistes weigh in...

title: 20.8% of proposed projects at Invest Kerala Global Summit are operational: P. Rajeeve
content: A total of 40,439 jobs are expected to be created through the projects that are operational now, says Industries Minister.

title: A.P. Governor exhorts students to be prepared for Quantum Valley
content: The Quantum Valley will place Andhra Pradesh at the forefront of quantum and deep technology advancement in Asia, says Governor S. Abdul Nazeer; It aims to foster innovation, high-end employment and environmental sustainability in Amaravati

title: Modi’s national security policy and foreign policy deceived India: Kharge
content: The AICC president also faulted the BJP-led Central government’s foreign policy and said this had resulted in India creating enemies all around, apart from China and Pakistan even friendly nations like Nepal are moving away from India, he said

title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi to host National Percussion Festival in Thrissur from July 11
content: Event will bring together diverse percussion traditions from across the country. Curated by Keli Ramachandran, festival aims at spotlighting rhythm as a powerful cultural, artistic, and political expression

title: Kerala HC refuses to stay suspension of Kerala University Registrar
content: The suspension order is an extra-statutory order issued by a statutory authority as the V-C can initiate disciplinary action against officials only up to the rank of Deputy Registrar and is hence illegal and must be set aside, says counsel of Anil Kumar

title: Allahabad HC rejects plea to refer Mathura’s Shahi Idgah as ‘disputed structure’
content: Neither desirable nor expedient to issue such directions at this point, says court; plaintiff trying to introduce a case through the backdoor, says counsel representing the mosque

title: From herding cattle to earning doctorate degree in geology
content: Accolades pour in for Chintha Paramesh of Kondanagula village in Nagarkurnool district on his transformational journey

title: Housing Minister inspects land for house sites allocation to the poor in Eluru district
content: The Minister directs authorities to complete the land survey and levelling work promptly so that housing plots can be distributed to eligible beneficiaries without delay

title: Over 2,000 women demand MGNREGA jobs in Nagapattinam
content: The delay in work allocation, attributed to the absence of elected local body representatives;  only ₹6.23 lakh has been disbursed as wages this financial year as against ₹3 crore to ₹4 crore a year in the past

title: IUML leader Khader Mohideen chosen for Thagaisal Thamizhar Award
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will present the award during the Independence Day celebrations in Chennai

title: Officials hopeful of TG-AP issues’ resolution at Cabinet meet on July 10
content: TG’s decision to call for officers’ committee meeting takes a backseat following AP’s moves on Banakacherla project

title: Curriculum committee approves chapter on Governor’s powers in school textbook
content: The chapter in Class 10 Social Science textbook also covers Emergency and the Supreme Court verdict that struck down electoral bonds. Second part of textbooks for Classes 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10, covering 95 titles, approved

title: Eluru District Collector instructs officials to draft action plans for constituency development
content: The goal is to eradicate poverty, generate employment for youth and ensure a 15% growth rate at the constituency-level, she says

title: Sixty years of Mathilukal marked with a wall of love
content: Students and faculty of Government Boys Higher Secondary School, Karamana commemorate the novel on the eve of Vaikom Mohammad Basheer’s death anniversary

title: Setback For Saif Ali Khan, Family As Rs 15,000 Crore Property Case Goes To Retrial
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has set aside a two-decade-old trial court judgment and ordered a fresh hearing in the case involving one of Bhopal's most protracted royal property disputes.

title: 'India's Interest More Important, Not Deadline': Piyush Goyal On US Trade Talks
content: India is in no hurry to finalise any major trade deal on the basis of a deadline, but will agree on a decision if it is a win-win for both parties, Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said today.

title: Ultratech Under Scanner In Cement Cartelisation Case
content: Fair trade regulator CCI has directed Aditya Birla firm UltraTech, which now owns south-based cement firm India Cements to submit financial documents after its Director General in its investigations found contravention of competition norms.

title: The Fireworks Origin: Why America Lights Up The Sky On 4th Of July
content: Every year on July 4, skies across the US light up with fireworks to mark the Independence Day.The US gained independence in 1776 after the 13 colonies declared their separation from British rule by adopting the Declaration of Independence.

title: Probe Agency Attaches Assets Worth Over Rs 34 Crore Of Actor Ranya Rao
content: Assets worth more than Rs 34 crore of Kannada actor Ranya Rao have been attached by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a gold smuggling-linked money-laundering case, officials said on Friday.

title: Bihar's Electoral Roll Revision: Reform Or Voter Exclusion Risk? Expert Flags Concerns
content: The upcoming assembly election in Bihar has prompted the Election Commission of India (ECI) to begin a special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, a large-scale verification of voters in sync with the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2003.

title: Microsoft Shuts Pakistan Operations After 25 Years, Cites Global Restructuring
content: Tech giant Microsoft has announced to shut down its limited operations in Pakistan as part of its global strategy to reduce workforce, which various stakeholders termed on Friday as a "troubling sign" for the country's economy.

title: How Enslaved Americans Responded To July 4 Declaration Of Declaration
content: The summer air in Rochester, New York, hung thick with heat and celebration. It was July 5, 1852, a day after cannons had fired, flags waved and towns across America had burst into patriotic jubilation

title: Dozens Hurt In Fuel Station Blast Heard Across Rome
content: A huge explosion at a petrol station in a Rome suburb injured nearly 30 people, two of them seriously, and rattled windows across the Italian capital.

title: Escaped Pet Lion Attacks Woman And Children On Pakistan Street
content: An escaped pet lion chased a woman and two children down a busy street in Pakistan's Lahore, police said, with dramatic footage showing the big cat leaping a wall before pouncing on them.

title: Man Who Raped Pune Techie Was Her Friend, She Herself Took Selfie: Police
content: A suspect detained in connection with the alleged rape of a Pune IT professional at her home was her friend and not a stranger who gained entry by posing as a courier delivery agent, police said on Friday, casting doubt on her version of the events.

title: Czech Republic Hit By Major Power Outage
content: A major power outage that hit parts of the Czech Republic, briefly halting underground trains in the capital Prague, was probably the result of a technical outage, with no signs of a cyber or terrorist attack, authorities said.

title: Russia Brushes Off Talks, Launches Largest Assault On Ukraine
content: The Kremlin said that it sees no immediate diplomatic way out of the war in Ukraine, hours after launching its largest ever drone and missile barrage of the invasion.

title: 4th Of July: Timeline Of Events That Followed The Birth Of America
content: The signing of the Declaration of Independence was the result of a month-long political process marked by debates, drafts, and key decisions over several days.

title: Chinese Sales Of Foreign Phone Makers, Including Apple, Drop 9.7% In May
content: Sales of foreign-branded mobile phones in China, including those of Apple Inc, fell 9.7% year-on-year in May, according to data released by a government-affiliated research company.

title: "45 Is The New 60": CA Warns India's Middle Class Could Be Broke By Mid-40s
content: India's middle class could face a retirement crisis by the age of 45 owing to rising lifestyle expenses, limited income, longevity and insufficient long-term savings, Chartered Accountant and wealth advisor Kanan Bahl has said.

title: Watch: NASA Mission Captures First Close Look At Peanut-Shaped Asteroid
content: NASA has released the first-ever high-resolution image of the main-belt asteroid Donaldjohanson, highlighting its unique peanut shape.

title: Man Pushes Wife Of Running Train In Jharkhand. She Falls In Ditch, Survives
content: A 25-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh on Friday allegedly pushed his wife out of a running train in Jharkhand, a police officer said.

title: 108 Kg Marijuana, Smuggled In Inverter Cases, Recovered From Noida
content: The gang was smuggling the drugs from Odisha by hiding them inside empty inverter shells and transporting them via train.

title: "Don't See God In Us, See God In Justice": Supreme Court On Lawyer's Remark
content: Don't see God in us, the Supreme Court on Friday remarked after a counsel said they saw God in judges.

title: Twist in Pune rape case: Woman knew accused from before, wrote 'threat note' herself
content: Pune police report a twist in the alleged rape case involving an IT professional, indicating the assailant was known to the woman. Evidence suggests the selfie used was taken and edited by her, and she typed the threatening message. Authorities are investigating the rape claim, noting inconsistencies in her initial account and her mental state.

title: India-US trade deal: 'We don't make deals based on deadlines,' says Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stated that any trade agreement between India and the United States will only occur if it benefits both nations. India does not adhere to deadlines for trade agreements.

title: Tesla CEO reiterates push to deorbit ISS: Shares post on Twitter; says ‘It’s time to retire…’
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi watches Edgbaston Test, reveals his role model
content: VVS Laxman orchestrated a valuable experience for India's U19 cricketers, arranging their visit to the Edgbaston Test to witness Shubman Gill's impressive innings. Coach Hrishikesh Kanitkar emphasized the importance of learning red-ball cricket techniques from Gill's masterful approach. Young players like Vaibhav Suryavanshi and Anmoljeet Singh expressed inspiration, fueling their aspirations to represent India after watching Gill's performance.

title: Worst in 148 years! Prasidh Krishna sets unwanted Test record
content: India initially dominated Day 3 of the second Test, dismissing key England batsmen early. However, Jamie Smith and Harry Brook launched a stunning counterattack, scoring centuries and shifting the momentum. Their aggressive batting dismantled India's bowling strategy, particularly punishing Prasidh Krishna, whose expensive spell highlighted concerns about India's pace attack.

title: Bhojpuri beats and Bihar ki Beti: India’s deep cultural connection with the Caribbean
content: If blues was the magic carried by African slaves, chutney music was the sorcery of Indo-Caribbeans. It is Bhojpuri folk electrified with Caribbean swagger – dholak beats fused with soca basslines and steelpan melodies. Lyrics toggle between Hindi, English, and Creole, telling stories of Krishna’s rasleela, rum-shop heartbreak, and gossip at weddings.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: ‘No position on matters of faith’: India reacts to Dalai Lama succession row
content: India has refrained from commenting on the selection process for the next Dalai Lama, emphasising its commitment to religious freedom. This stance follows the current Dalai Lama's declaration that his successor will be chosen by the Gaden Phodrang Trust, a statement perceived as a challenge to China's claim to appoint the next spiritual leader.

title: Scary scene! Shubman Gill takes nasty blow to the head
content: During the second Test against England, Indian captain Shubman Gill was struck on the head while fielding, causing immediate concern. Fortunately, after treatment, he resumed playing. This incident followed Gill's emotional high after receiving messages from his parents, celebrating his record-breaking double century, marking a significant milestone in his career and India's Test history in England.

title: Marathi slapgate row: Fadnavis says 'hooliganism will not be tolerated'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has vowed zero tolerance for hooliganism in the name of Marathi pride, following recent assaults on individuals for not speaking the language. This statement comes after incidents like the Mira Road assault, where a shop owner was attacked.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: 'Reserve right to ...': Amidst trade talks, India eyes retaliatory duties against US
content: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the United States at the WTO in response to American safeguard measures on the automobile sector. The US imposed a 25% tariff increase on imports of passenger vehicles, light trucks, and specific automobile parts from India.

title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'
content: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.

title: Samruddhi Expressway crash: Nagpur businessman Radheshyam Jaiswal among 4 dead
content: A tragic accident on the Samruddhi Expressway near Washim claimed the lives of four members of the Jaiswal family from Umred. The incident occurred when their car collided with a divider, resulting in the deaths of Radheshyam Jaiswal, Madhuri Jaiswal, Vaidehi Jaiswal, and Sangeeta Jaiswal. The driver is critically injured and under treatment.

title: Lauren Kyle Builds Own Legacy: Connor McDavid's wife makes mark in design and fashion
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid is emerging as a prominent figure in Edmonton's design and fashion scene, establishing her own identity beyond her husband's hockey fame. She launched Trove Living, a high-end furniture showroom and design firm, and founded Sports Club Atelier, a sportswear label. With McDavid's support, Kyle's entrepreneurial spirit is transforming Edmonton's creative landscape, marking her as a rising force.

title: Connor McDavid’s mindset: What is it according to insiders' view on Oilers contract
content: An insider view into Connor McDavid’s current mindset paints a complex picture as the Edmonton Oilers superstar weighs his future. While no official contract talks have started, NHL analysis suggests that the ongoing silence could lead to mounting pressure if the Oilers fail to align with McDavid’s long-term goals.

title: Cardi B reacts sharply: Stefon Diggs’ Europe trip stirs buzz, cryptic 3-word message
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over
content: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest — 354 runs in 14 games — his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.

title: 38 years of guilt: Kerala man, in his 50s, confesses to killing unknown man in 1986
content: In Kerala's Malappuram district, Muhammadali, 52, confessed to a killing he committed as a 14-year-old in 1986. He claims he acted in self-defense after being harassed while working on Devassya's property in Kozhikode. Burdened by guilt following recent family tragedies, Muhammadali led police to the scene.

title: Watch: Massive fireball erupts in Rome fuel depot; over 20 injured
content: A massive explosion at a Rome fuel station injured 20, including eight police officers responding to the scene. Initial reports suggest a truck crashed into a pipeline, triggering the blast and subsequent fires. The incident, marked by a large fireball and thick smoke, prompted evacuations of nearby buildings, including a children's camp.

title: Dalai Lama successor: Tibet's prez-in-exile picks apart China's 'Golden Urn' tradition
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) president, Penpa Tsering, challenged China's claim over the Dalai Lama's succession, questioning Beijing's interference in Tibetan religious freedom. This response follows China's insistence on the 'Golden Urn' process, which Tsering argues is a relatively recent imposition.

title: DSP Siraj breathes fire! Sends Stokes for a duck, leaves Root fuming - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test has put India in a commanding position. He dismissed Joe Root and then Ben Stokes for a golden duck in consecutive deliveries. Root edged a flick to Pant, while Stokes was undone by a sharp bouncer. India aims to level the series after England's initial victory.

title: 'Is ECI God?': Pappu Yadav's 'do-or-die' call as Bihar roll revision row flares
content: Pappu Yadav, a Congress-leaning MP, has declared a "do-or-die battle" against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar, labeling the ECI as an "office of the RSS." Congress has also criticized the revision as a "sinister exercise" to disenfranchise voters. Despite opposition protests, parties like RJD, Congress, and others have deployed thousands of BLAs for the revision process.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps out: Special mother-daughter night, honors Dodgers’ Clayton Kershaw
content: Vanessa Bryant, continuing the family's Dodgers fandom, attended a game with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri. The family cheered on their favorite team as Clayton Kershaw achieved his 3,000th strikeout, a significant milestone. Vanessa shared photos and videos of the special night on Instagram, highlighting the family's love for baseball and celebrating Kershaw's achievement.

title: Krishna Janmabhoomi row: Allahabad HC says Shahi Eidgah ‘not disputed’; plea dismissed
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea by the Shahi Jama Masjid committee, challenging a survey of the Shahi Idgah mosque in Sambhal. Hindus claim the mosque was built over a demolished temple.

title: Caught on cam: Man sets relative's house on fire over financial dispute
content: In Bengaluru's Vivek Nagar, Subramani allegedly set fire to his relative Sathish Kumar's house over a financial dispute. The incident, occurring on July 1st, caused damage to the property, though no injuries were reported. The conflict stemmed from a loan taken years ago by Parvati from Venkataramani.

title: Reshad Jones loses $2.6M: Alleged con by trusted advisor; luxury spending spree
content: Former Miami Dolphins safety Reshad Jones, known for his on-field prowess, is now a victim of a $2.6 million embezzlement scheme. Financial advisor Isaiah Williams allegedly siphoned funds for personal luxuries, with Octavia Monique Graham accused of laundering over $1 million. Graham is in custody, while Williams remains at large, leaving Jones grappling with betrayal and significant financial loss.

title: Elon Musk wants the ISS retired: Slams Trump’s $1.25 billion funding
content: Elon Musk wants the International Space Station to shut down. He suggests focusing on Mars missions instead. He thinks the ISS is old and costly. NASA plans to deorbit the ISS by 2030. Some support Musk's Mars vision. Others worry about losing ISS research and partnerships. A gradual shift is a suggested solution. The debate continues.

title: Joe Burrow trends online: Fans spot him alone, 'extremely sad' in Beverly Hills
content: A video shows Joe Burrow walking alone in Beverly Hills. This has led to fan concern. The Bengals quarterback appeared downcast. Social media is full of reactions and theories. Some fans worry about his well-being. Others speculate about the reason for his mood. There is no official statement from Burrow or the Bengals. The internet continues to discuss the video.

title: Delhi double murder: Boy walked into scene of mother's murder, tried to hide in bathroom
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar, Mukesh Paswan, a garment worker, murdered his employer's wife and teenage son. The gruesome crime occurred after a dispute over a Rs 45,000 advance and Paswan's absenteeism. He was arrested in UP while attempting to flee.

title: CUET UG 2025 scorecards released at examinationservices.nic.in, check direct link here
content: The CUET UG 2025 result has been officially declared by the National Testing Agency. Over 13 lakh candidates can now check their scorecards on cuet.nta.nic.in or through the direct result link. The scores will be used for admissions across 243 universities, including DU, BHU, JNU, and AMU. This year’s results are based on normalised percentiles, and include postponed papers such as Tamil, Urdu, and accountancy. Counselling and admission processes will begin shortly.

title: Watch: Russian boxer gives e-cigarette to orangutan; video sparks outrage
content: Russian boxer Anastasia Luchkina is under fire after a video surfaced showing her giving an e-cigarette to Dana, an orangutan at a Crimean safari park. The endangered orangutan has since exhibited disturbing behavior, including loss of appetite and lethargy. Veterinarians are examining Dana, fearing she may have ingested the nicotine cartridge, while the incident has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.

title: 'Drag India forward like Kohli': Vaughan's challenge to Gill, Jaiswal, Pant
content: Michael Vaughan believes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant must collectively fill the void left by Virat Kohli's departure from Test cricket. Vaughan acknowledged their potential but emphasised the need to replicate Kohli's intensity and global dominance to maintain India's competitive edge. He cautioned against underestimating the impact of losing Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

title: Himachal rain crisis: 69 dead, many missing; rescue ops on
content: Torrential rains and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh have claimed at least 69 lives and caused over Rs 400 crore in damages since June 20. Mandi district is the worst-hit, with homes collapsing and vehicles being swept away. Rescue operations are underway as the IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall and potential landslides.

title: Trent share price today: Stock drops around 9%; Nuvama downgrades
content: Trent Ltd.'s shares plummeted 8.7% after its AGM revealed a projected revenue growth slowdown to 20% for Q1FY26, significantly lower than the previous 35% CAGR. Nuvama brokerage downgraded the stock to 'hold,' reducing the target price due to concerns about moderating growth and high valuations.

title: Aastha Poonia becomes 1st woman to be trained as fighter pilot
content: Slt Aastha Poonia made history as the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot in the Indian Navy. She and Lt Atul Kumar Dhull were awarded the 'Wings of Gold' at @IN_Dega. This achievement marks a significant step towards gender inclusivity in Naval Aviation, promoting equality and opportunity within the Indian Navy.

title: Drunk teacher dances with schoolgirls in classroom; suspended after viral video
content: A shocking video surfaced from Pashupatipur Primary School in Wadrafnagar, showing headmaster Laxmi Narayan Singh intoxicated and dancing inappropriately with girl students. This misconduct, along with allegations of frequent inebriation and unwarranted physical punishment, prompted swift action. Balrampur District Education Officer D N Mishra suspended Singh, and local MLA Shakuntala Porte demanded strict disciplinary measures.

title: Tamil Nadu 2026 polls: TVK names actor Vijay CM candidate; can he take on MK Stalin?
content: Vijay, the Tamil film star, has been announced as the chief ministerial candidate for his party, Tamizhaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK), in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections. TVK, launched in February 2024, aims to bring fundamental political change. Vijay plans a state-wide tour from September to December to strengthen the party's base.

title: Chess | 'No time for noise': Vidit Gujrathi hits out at 'LiverDoc' for insulting doctor parents, family
content: Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi defended his family members' professions after a social media user questioned their legitimacy as doctors on National Doctors' Day. The dispute arose when Gujrathi acknowledged his father, an ayurvedic specialist, mother, a cosmetologist, sister, a physiotherapist, and wife, a homeopathic doctor.

title: ‘Proud mom moment’: Hillary Trocheck reacts as Will Cuylle renews contract with NHL team
content: When rookie Will Cuylle faced living in a hotel, Vincent Trocheck, remembering his own challenging start, offered him a home with his family in Harrison, New York. Cuylle quickly became part of the Trocheck family, celebrated by Vincent's wife, Hillary, who proudly calls him her son. Recently, Cuylle signed a two-year, $7.

title: Tantransco plans underground 110 kV feeder lines at Panjapur
content: The Tidel Park Ltd paid ₹28 crore to Tantransco for relocating the power lines; the power utility will first dismantle the 66 kV feeder lines, which are kept as reserve and later take up 110 kV Tiruchi-Thanjavur and 110 kV Tiruchi-Thuvakudi feeder lines

title: Amit Shah to lay foundation for India’s first national cooperative university in Gujarat
content: The varsity aims to address the growing need for skilled professionals in cooperative sector by offering specialised education, training and research programmes in cooperative management, finance, law and rural development

title: Forward looking reforms have transformed mining sector: Kishan Reddy
content: Mining sector fast emerging as champion of green transformation, the Minister told a conference on sustainable and responsible mining through best mine closure practices

title: Padayappa steals the show at a drawing competition in Munnar
content: At a drawing competition held as part of the Vana Mahotsavam celebrations at Government Anglo Tamil Primary School, all participants drew the picture of the wild elephant for the theme ‘Beauty of Munnar,’ say Forest department officials

title: New Responsible Tourism project to be introduced to aid landslides-hit people of Wayanad
content: Interested people from Meppadi to be trained in making handicrafts and souvenirs, which will be branded and marketed. Select members to be offered tour leader training. State government sanctions ₹13.58 lakh to impart training to the first batch

title: Issue 21 lakh new pattadar passbooks in first phase from August, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells Revenue officials
content: The Chief Minister also directs officials to issue succession certificates in respect of inherited lands and complete regularisation of unobjectionable government lands by the end of 2025

title: Naidu seeks GST exemption for mango pulp, Central aid of ₹130 cr. for procuring Totapuri mangoes
content: A recent slump in exports coupled with weak domestic demand has led to a crisis, leaving over 1.50 lakh metric tonnes of mango pulp unsold in Chittoor district, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu in a representation to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, he also seeks a reduction of GST on fruit-based juices to 5% from 12%

title: Resorting to violence over Marathi unacceptable, you can't be obstinate about it: Devendra Fadnavis
content: "You can ask people to speak Marathi in Maharashtra, but you cannot be obstinate about Marathi," Mr. Fadnavis told reporters

title: Odisha BJP likely to get new president by July 8
content: The nominations will be accepted on July 7, while voting for the post of state president will be held on July 8, if required, said the statement issued by Balasore MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi, the party’s state election officer

title: Protests escalate at Kerala University as SFI attempts to block entry of interim V-C Ciza Thomas
content: Activists attempt to block her again as she attempted to leave campus. SFI workers, police personnel clash in the process. Higher Education Minister writes to Ciza to revoke suspension order against Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar

title: Panchayat says collapsed building lacked fitness certificate
content: Panchayat officials say several buildings within the Kottayam MCH are in a state of disrepair, with no maintenance conducted for several years. They claim hospital authorities respond with indifference whenever they raise their concerns.

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan lays stone for ₹1,290-crore Jal Jeevan Mission works in Prakasam district
content: Once completed, the first phase of the scheme will supply drinking water for 30 years to over 10 lakh population spread over 578 villages of 18 mandals in seven Assembly constituencies, he says

title: Over 200 weapons, 30 IEDs recovered in Manipur hill districts
content: Joint teams from Manipur Police, Assam Rifles, Army, and Central Armed Police Forces conducted operations, resulting in the recovery of numerous weapons, ammunition, explosives, and other warlike stores

title: Freedom fighter’s family gets land rights after long dispute
content: The family of freedom fighter Chellasamy of Keezhkurichi in Tiruverumbur taluk found that another patta had been issued for the land that it had received in 2005 under a government scheme

title: Private bus operators in Vadakara go on token strike over poor road conditions
content: The dawn-to-dusk protest organised by a joint action committee of bus operators disrupted the regular bus services between Kozhikode and Kannur districts on Friday

title: I&PR Minister highlights welfare schemes launched by Andhra Pradesh government during his visit to Eluru district
content: Kolusu Parthasarathy approves six new road works in response to local requests and directs officials to resolve public issues promptly

title: Work on culverts to prevent flooding on GST Road in Pallavaram and Chromepet to begin soon
content: Sources in the Highways Department say tenders for the project have already been floated by the railways

title: Sources: M. Wagner rejoins Magic on 1-year deal
content: Free agent forward/center Moe Wagner has agreed to a one-year, $5 million deal to return to the Magic, sources told ESPN.

title: 'Devastated': Liverpool teammates grieve Jota
content: Diogo Jota's teammates at Liverpool including Virgil van Dijk and Jordan Henderson have been expressing their grief following the forward's death.

title: Keys stumbles, Osaka fades in Wimbledon losses
content: Madison Keys became the latest top-seeded player to suffer an early loss at Wimbledon, while Naomi Osaka once again exited in the third round.

title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey charged with rape
content: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault by the Metropolitan Police Service.

title: 2 allegedly stole $2M+ from ex-Dolphins safety
content: A woman is in jail after she and a former financial adviser were accused of stealing millions of dollars from former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones.

title: Boxer Chávez Jr. arrested by ICE, to be deported
content: The family of Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. says it has "full confidence in his innocence" after he was arrested by U.S. immigration officers and set to be deported to Mexico.

title: Trump wants UFC fight on White House grounds
content: President Donald Trump says he is thinking of staging a UFC match on the White House grounds with upward of 20,000 spectators to celebrate 250 years of American independence.

title: Hammon slams Aces' 'trash' effort in 27-point loss
content: The Aces shot 26.2% and were routed 81-54 by the Fever, causing coach Becky Hammon to call it "one of the worst games I've ever seen."

title: 🏈 Who's the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever?
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: Arsenal end defender Tomiyasu's contract
content: Julien Laurens explains why he thinks Viktor Gyökeres could end up at Arsenal. (0:54) Arsenal  have announced that defender  Takehiro Tomiyasu 's contract at the club has expired. The Japan international leaves the club after an injury-hit four years in north London, where he made 84 appearances in all competitions. "Everyone at Arsenal Football Club would like to thank Tomi for his contribution to the club and we wish him and his family all the best for the future," the  club said in a statement. Tomiyasu's exit comes amid a significant turnover at Arsenal this summer that has already seen  Jorginho ,  Thomas Partey ,  Kieran Tierney ,  Nuno Tavares  and  Marquinhos  leave the club, with  Martín Zubimendi  set to join. ESPN reported  last month that the club are also in talks with  Brentford  over midfielder  Christian Nørgaard . Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta is on a mission to guide his side to their first trophy since lifting the FA Cup in 2020.
